title: What is the best way to invest 10 lakhs for children? - Quora

response.answer_text: 10 lakh is a huge sum and it won’t be advisable to invest all of it in one place. You can bifurcate the whole amount and invest it in different places. The first things I would suggest is to save money for their higher education. You can invest 35% of the given figure in fixed deposit for a minimum of 5 years. The tenure can be higher depending on the age of your kid. If your child is a toddler, you can invest for a higher period, maybe for 10 years or so. If your child is older than that, find out when will he/she be needing the money and invest accordingly. After that, there are a couple of special schemes backed by the Indian government which allows the investor to invest a significant amount of money for the welfare of their children and attain the benefits without any tax deductions. You have to find those schemes and invest at least 40% of the amount in respective schemes. The third important thing would be to secure your child’s health with a good health insurance. Lastly, you can invest the rest of the amount in fitting fixed deposit schemes under your name and list your child as the beneficiary. However, you have to be very calculative while doing so and invest in a way to reduce the taxation limit to a minimum. Also Read : Fixed Deposits For Securing Your Child’s Future

It depends upon couple of things namely: What is the purpose of Investment?Their Education/Marriage/ GiftWhat is the tenure for Investment?3–5 yrs/ 5 - 10 yrs/ 10 - 15 yrs / 15 yrs +What are your expected Returns?Based upon your Risk Appetite ( Aggressive/Moderate/Conservative)Based upon Type of GoalA person has a higher Risk Appetite for Marriage compared to their EducationAssuming the investment is for a long tenure of approx 10 yrs plus, you may go for a Dynamic Asset Allocation Fund with a mix of Debt & Equity, where Equity allocation would keep on changing based upon how expensive or cheap the Equity valuation are.
